intro: Androsace albertina, commonly known as the Albertina rock jasmine, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit, with small, fleshy leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate floral display to mountainous landscapes. Androsace albertina is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in rock gardens.
